refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GooCanvas is the main widget containing a number of canvas items.

refsect2.title: GooCanvas
refsect2.para: The GooCanvas struct contains private data only.

refsect2.title: GooCanvasClass
refsect2.para: The GooCanvasClass struct contains one virtual method that subclasses may override.

listitem.simpara: a virtual method that subclasses may override to create custom canvas items for item models.
signal emitted when a new canvas item has been created. Applications can connect to this to setup signal handlers for the new item.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GooCanvas widget.
A GooCanvasGroup is created automatically as the root item of the canvas, though this can be overriden with goo_canvas_set_root_item() or goo_canvas_set_root_item_model().

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_root_item ()
refsect2.para: Gets the root item of the canvas, usually a GooCanvasGroup.

listitem.simpara: the root item, or NULL if there is no root item.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_set_root_item ()
refsect2.para: Sets the root item of the canvas. Any existing canvas items are removed.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_root_item_model ()
refsect2.para: Gets the root item model of the canvas.

listitem.simpara: the root item model, or NULL if there is no root item model.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_set_root_item_model ()
refsect2.para: Sets the root item model of the canvas.
A hierarchy of canvas items will be created, corresponding to the hierarchy of items in the model. Any current canvas items will be removed.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_bounds ()
refsect2.programlisting: void goo_canvas_get_bounds (GooCanvas *canvas, gdouble *left, gdouble *top, gdouble *right, gdouble *bottom);
refsect2.para: Gets the bounds of the canvas, in canvas units.
By default, canvas units are pixels, though the GooCanvas:units property can be used to change the units to points, inches or millimeters.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to a gdouble to return the left edge, or NULL.
a pointer to a gdouble to return the top edge, or NULL.
a pointer to a gdouble to return the right edge, or NULL.
a pointer to a gdouble to return the bottom edge, or NULL.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_set_bounds ()
refsect2.programlisting: void goo_canvas_set_bounds (GooCanvas *canvas, gdouble left, gdouble top, gdouble right, gdouble bottom);
refsect2.para: Sets the bounds of the GooCanvas, in canvas units.
By default, canvas units are pixels, though the GooCanvas:units property can be used to change the units to points, inches or millimeters.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_scale ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current scale of the canvas.
The scale specifies the magnification factor of the canvas, e.g. if an item has a width of 2 pixels and the scale is set to 3, it will be displayed with a width of 2 x 3 = 6 pixels.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_set_scale ()
refsect2.para: Sets the scale of the canvas.
The scale specifies the magnification factor of the canvas, e.g. if an item has a width of 2 pixels and the scale is set to 3, it will be displayed with a width of 2 x 3 = 6 pixels.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_item ()
refsect2.para: Gets the canvas item associated with the given GooCanvasItemModel. This is only useful when goo_canvas_set_root_item_model() has been used to set a model for the canvas.
For simple applications you can use goo_canvas_get_item() to set up signal handlers for your items, e.g.
More complex applications may want to use the GooCanvas::item-created signal to hook up their signal handlers.

listitem.simpara: the canvas item corresponding to the given GooCanvasItemModel, or NULL if no canvas item has been created for it yet.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_item_at ()
refsect2.programlisting: GooCanvasItem* goo_canvas_get_item_at (GooCanvas *canvas, gdouble x, gdouble y, gboolean is_pointer_event);
refsect2.para: Gets the item at the given point.

listitem.simpara: the x coordinate of the point.
the y coordinate of the point
TRUE if the "pointer-events" property of items should be used to determine which parts of the item are tested.
the item found at the given point, or NULL if no item was found.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_items_at ()
refsect2.programlisting: GList* goo_canvas_get_items_at (GooCanvas *canvas, gdouble x, gdouble y, gboolean is_pointer_event);
refsect2.para: Gets all items at the given point.

listitem.simpara: the x coordinate of the point.
the y coordinate of the point
TRUE if the "pointer-events" property of items should be used to determine which parts of the item are tested.
a list of items found at the given point, with the top item at the start of the list, or NULL if no items were found. The list must be freed with g_list_free().

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_items_in_area ()
refsect2.programlisting: GList* goo_canvas_get_items_in_area (GooCanvas *canvas, const GooCanvasBounds *area, gboolean inside_area, gboolean allow_overlaps, gboolean include_containers);
refsect2.para: Gets a list of items inside or outside a given area.

listitem.simpara: the area to compare with each item's bounds.
TRUE if items inside area should be returned, or FALSE if items outside area should be returned.
TRUE if items which are partly inside and partly outside should be returned.
TRUE if containers should be checked as well as normal items.
a list of items in the given area, or NULL if no items are found. The list should be freed with g_list_free().

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_scroll_to ()
refsect2.para: Scrolls the canvas, placing the given point as close to the top-left of the view as possible.

listitem.simpara: the x coordinate to scroll to.
the y coordinate to scroll to.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_render ()
refsect2.programlisting: void goo_canvas_render (GooCanvas *canvas, cairo_t *cr, const GooCanvasBounds *bounds, gdouble scale);
refsect2.para: Renders all or part of a canvas to the given cairo context.

listitem.simpara: the area to render, or NULL to render the entire canvas.
the scale to compare with each item's visibility threshold to see if they should be rendered. This only affects items that have their visibility set to GOO_CANVAS_ITEM_VISIBLE_ABOVE_THRESHOLD.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_convert_to_pixels ()
refsect2.para: Converts a coordinate from the canvas coordinate space to pixels.
The canvas coordinate space is specified in the call to goo_canvas_set_bounds().
The pixel coordinate space specifies pixels from the top-left of the entire canvas window, according to the current scale setting. See goo_canvas_set_scale().

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the x coordinate to convert.
a pointer to the y coordinate to convert.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_convert_from_pixels ()
refsect2.para: Converts a coordinate from pixels to the canvas coordinate space.
The pixel coordinate space specifies pixels from the top-left of the entire canvas window, according to the current scale setting. See goo_canvas_set_scale().
The canvas coordinate space is specified in the call to goo_canvas_set_bounds().

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the x coordinate to convert.
a pointer to the y coordinate to convert.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_convert_to_item_space ()
refsect2.para: Converts a coordinate from the canvas coordinate space to the given item's coordinate space, applying all transformation matrices including the item's own transformation matrix, if it has one.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the x coordinate to convert.
a pointer to the y coordinate to convert.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_convert_from_item_space ()
refsect2.para: Converts a coordinate from the given item's coordinate space to the canvas coordinate space, applying all transformation matrices including the item's own transformation matrix, if it has one.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the x coordinate to convert.
a pointer to the y coordinate to convert.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_pointer_grab ()
refsect2.programlisting: GdkGrabStatus goo_canvas_pointer_grab (GooCanvas *canvas, GooCanvasItem *item, GdkEventMask event_mask, GdkCursor *cursor, guint32 time);
refsect2.para: Attempts to grab the pointer for the given item.

listitem.simpara: the item to grab the pointer for.
the events to receive during the grab.
the cursor to display during the grab, or NULL.
the time of the event that lead to the pointer grab. This should come from the relevant GdkEvent.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_pointer_ungrab ()
refsect2.para: Ungrabs the pointer, if the given item has the pointer grab.

listitem.simpara: the item that has the grab.
the time of the event that lead to the pointer ungrab. This should come from the relevant GdkEvent.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_grab_focus ()
refsect2.para: Grabs the keyboard focus for the given item.

listitem.simpara: the item to grab the focus.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_keyboard_grab ()
refsect2.programlisting: GdkGrabStatus goo_canvas_keyboard_grab (GooCanvas *canvas, GooCanvasItem *item, gboolean owner_events, guint32 time);
refsect2.para: Attempts to grab the keyboard for the given item.

listitem.simpara: the item to grab the keyboard for.
TRUE if keyboard events for this application will be reported normally, or FALSE if all keyboard events will be reported with respect to the grab item.
the time of the event that lead to the keyboard grab. This should come from the relevant GdkEvent.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_keyboard_ungrab ()
refsect2.para: Ungrabs the keyboard, if the given item has the keyboard grab.

listitem.simpara: the item that has the keyboard grab.
the time of the event that lead to the keyboard ungrab. This should come from the relevant GdkEvent.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_create_cairo_context ()
refsect2.para: Creates a cairo context, initialized with the default canvas settings.

listitem.simpara: a new cairo context. It should be freed with cairo_destroy().

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_create_item ()
refsect2.para: This function is only intended to be used when implementing new canvas items, typically container items such as GooCanvasGroup.
It creates a new canvas item for the given item model, and recursively creates items for any children.
It uses the create_item() virtual method if it has been set. Subclasses of GooCanvas can define this method if they want to use custom views for items.
It emits the GooCanvas::item-created signal after creating the view, so application code can connect signal handlers to the new view if desired.

listitem.simpara: the item model to create a canvas item for.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_unregister_item ()
refsect2.para: This function is only intended to be used when implementing new canvas items.
It should be called in the finalize method of GooCanvasItem objects, to remove the canvas item from the GooCanvas's hash table.

listitem.simpara: the item model whose canvas item is being finalized.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_register_widget_item ()
refsect2.para: This function should only be used by GooCanvasWidget and subclass implementations.
It registers a widget item with the canvas, so that the canvas can do the necessary actions to move and resize the widget as needed.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_unregister_widget_item ()
refsect2.para: This function should only be used by GooCanvasWidget and subclass implementations.
It unregisters a widget item from the canvas, when the item is no longer in the canvas.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_update ()
refsect2.para: This function is only intended to be used by subclasses of GooCanvas or GooCanvasItem implementations.
It updates any items that need updating.
If the bounds of items change, they will request a redraw of the old and new bounds so the display is updated correctly.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_request_update ()
refsect2.para: This function is only intended to be used by subclasses of GooCanvas or GooCanvasItem implementations.
It schedules an update of the GooCanvas. This will be performed in the idle loop, after all pending events have been handled, but before the canvas has been repainted.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_request_redraw ()
refsect2.para: This function is only intended to be used by subclasses of GooCanvas or GooCanvasItem implementations.
Requests that the given bounds be redrawn.

refsect2.title: goo_canvas_get_default_line_width ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default line width, which depends on the current units setting.

listitem.simpara: the default line width of the canvas.

refsect2.title: The "anchor" property
refsect2.para: Where to place the canvas when it is smaller than the widget's allocated area.
Default value: GTK_ANCHOR_NORTH_WEST

refsect2.title: The "background-color" property
refsect2.para: The color to use for the canvas background.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "background-color-rgb" property
refsect2.para: The color to use for the canvas background, specified as a 24-bit integer value, 0xRRGGBB.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "resolution-x" property
refsect2.para: The horizontal resolution of the display, in dots per inch.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 96

refsect2.title: The "resolution-y" property
refsect2.para: The vertical resolution of the display, in dots per inch.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 96

refsect2.title: The "scale" property
refsect2.para: The magnification factor of the canvas.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "units" property
refsect2.para: The units to use for the canvas.
Default value: GTK_UNIT_PIXEL

refsect2.title: The "x1" property
refsect2.para: The x coordinate of the left edge of the canvas bounds, in canvas units.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "x2" property
refsect2.para: The x coordinate of the right edge of the canvas bounds, in canvas units.
Default value: 1000

refsect2.title: The "y1" property
refsect2.para: The y coordinate of the top edge of the canvas bounds, in canvas units.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "y2" property
refsect2.para: The y coordinate of the bottom edge of the canvas bounds, in canvas units.
Default value: 1000

refsect2.title: The "item-created" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GooCanvas *canvas, GooCanvasItem *item, GooCanvasItemModel *model, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: This is emitted when a new canvas item is created, in model/view mode.
Applications can set up signal handlers for the new items here.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "set-scroll-adjustments" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GooCanvas *canvas, GtkAdjustment *hadjustment, GtkAdjustment *vadjustment, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: This is used when the GooCanvas is placed inside a GtkScrolledWindow, to connect up the adjustments so scrolling works properly.
It isn't useful for applications.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
